claim: If the dataset also cataloged mythological giants from outside superhero franchises, at least one of them would exceed Surtur in height.
extra_info: who refers to superhero_name; tallest superhero refers to MAX(height_cm);
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim. It hypothesizes about what would happen 'if the dataset also cataloged mythological giants from outside superhero franchises.' The database only records what it actually contains, not what would happen under hypothetical additions. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from a database that only records actual data.

content.text:
This claim is a counterfactual/hypothetical statement. It says "If the dataset also cataloged mythological giants from outside superhero franchises..." — this describes a hypothetical scenario about data that doesn't exist in the database.

The database only records what it actually contains. It cannot verify what "would" happen if additional data were added. This is a classic counterfactual claim.
